verses.verse: He shall abide before God forever. Oh, prepare mercy (Ps. 40:11) and truth, which may preserve him!
So I will sing praise to Your name forever, That I may daily perform my vows.

(A Calm Resolve to Wait for the Salvation of God) To the Chief Musician. To (1 Chr. 25:1) Jeduthun. A Psalm of David. [1] Truly (Ps. 33:20) my soul silently waits for God; From Him comes my salvation.
He only is my rock and my salvation; He is my defense; I shall not be greatly (Ps. 55:22) moved.
How long will you attack a man? You shall be slain, all of you, (Is. 30:13) Like a leaning wall and a tottering fence.
They only consult to cast him down from his high position; They (Ps. 28:3) delight in lies; They bless with their mouth, But they curse inwardly. Selah
My soul, wait silently for God alone, For my expectation is from Him.
He only is my rock and my salvation; He is my defense; I shall not be moved.
((Jer. 3:23)) In God is my salvation and my glory; The rock of my strength, And my refuge, is in God.
Trust in Him at all times, you people; (1 Sam. 1:15; Ps. 42:4; Lam. 2:19) Pour out your heart before Him; God is a refuge for us. Selah
(Job 7:16; Ps. 39:5; Is. 40:17) Surely men of low degree are a vapor, Men of high degree are a lie; If they are weighed on the scales, They are altogether lighter than vapor.
